VarJackpot Variant CoverAlison Sampson2
Var1:10 BOOM! Studios 10 Years Incentive Variant CoverFrazer Irving3/4
Var1:20 Variant CoverPaul Maybury5

'ALIENS WITH DIRTY FACES' The Dragonmir Vampire Clan has all but succeeded in wiping out the the Gangsters who run 1920s New York. Only mobster Eddie Falco stands in their way. Bloody, bruised and on the run, he finds an unlikely ally in the form of the interplanetary smuggler known as Squeed. But can even the brother from another planet turn the crimson tide? Hard-boiled pulp action from start to finish!

name: Turf #001 (2010-04-01) - The Fangs Of New York!.cbr

summary.description:
A four-issue hard boiled noir crime thriller with girls, guns, fangs and aliens.

New York, 1929. The height of prohibition. The cops turn a blind eye while the mobs run the city, dealing in guns, girls and illegal liquor. But the arrival of the mysterious Dragonmir Family from Eastern Europe with more of a taste for blood then booze co-incides with a series of brutal attacks on the gangsters themselves. As the gangs fall before the fangs, only handful of mobsters survive. But an unlikely alliance formed between tough guy Eddie Falco and a character from a LONG way from New York City – a long way from Earth in fact - offers the humans a glimmer of hope. As the strong willed young reporter Susie Dale from the Gotham Herald tries to survive in the middle of the maelstrom, and an ancient prophecy unfolds, no one can guess who’s going to win the battle for this particular slice of Turf.

This issue was reprinted in Mark Millar's CLiNT #1.
summary.name: The Fangs Of New York!

name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way #005 (2007-02-01) .cbr

volume.name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way

name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way #004 (2006-09-01) .cbz

volume.name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way

name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way #003 (2006-06-01) .cbr

volume.name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way

name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way #002 (2006-04-01) .cbr

volume.name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way

name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way #001 (2006-03-01) .cbr

volume.name: Truth, Justin, and the American Way

name: Transmetropolitan- Filth of the City #001 (2001-05-01) - Filth of the City.cbr

summary.description: More of Spider Jerusalem's columns from his residency in the City newspaper The Word are featured, running from where the TRANSMETROPOLITAN: I HATE IT HERE one-shot left off and concluding with Spider's ultimate departure from the paper, accompanied by artwork from an array of the finest luminaries from both mainstream and indie comics.
summary.name: Filth of the City

name: Transmetropolitan- Back on the Street #001 (1998-01-01) - Back on the Street.cbr

summary.description:
The acclaimed Vertigo series from writer Warren Ellis (PLANETARY and THE AUTHORITY) and artist Darick Robertson, TRANSMETROPOLITAN combines black humor, life-threatening situations, and moral ambiguity to look into the gonzo mind of an outlaw journalist and the world he seeks to destroy.

After years of self-imposed exile from a civilizationrife with degradation and indecency, cynical journalist Spider Jerusalem is forced to return to a job he hates and a city he loathes. Working as an investigative reporter for the newspaper The Word, Spider attacks the injustices of his surreal 23rd Century surroundings. Spider ventures into the dangerous Angels 8 district, home of the Transients —humans who have decided to become aliens through cosmetic surgery. But Spider's interview with the Transients' leader gets him a scoop he didn't bargain for.

Introduction done by Garth Ennis.
summary.name: Back on the Street

name: Transmetropolitan #060 (2002-11-01) - One More Time.cbr

summary.description:
Final issue! This is it. It's all over. This is the final episode; in which Mitchell Royce takes a trip to Spider Jerusalem's final resting place for an ending you might not expect!

Mitch visits Spider in his country hide-away. The two assistants are seen taking care of Spider. Seems he's falling apart, the info-pollen is taking his physical dexterity, his memory, the most of what he can do is dig in the garden or sit and enjoy the wonderful air. Saddened, Mitch leaves. Spider, still in his chair, ponders that one percent of people suffering from the info-pollen disease recover. Then he deftly lights a cigarette and laughs wildlly.
summary.name: One More Time

name: Transmetropolitan #059 (2002-10-01) - The Long Day Closes.cbr

summary.description: It's Spider Jerusalem in his final meeting with President Callahan, surrounded by a city on fire and government troops in open conflict with civilians. It all ends here for these two--one way or the other.
summary.name: The Long Day Closes

name: Transmetropolitan #058 (2002-09-01) - Straight to Hell.cbr

summary.description: The government troops enforcing martial law across a spreading area of the City just put a lit match to the social tinderbox. All the tensions of the last two years are going to turn into a fireball and Spider and his team have nowhere left to run!
summary.name: Straight to Hell

name: Transmetropolitan #057 (2002-08-01) - Headlong- Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: The City looks to be on course for a riot, and the only person who could possibly stop it all is the President--or, at least, the removal of the President. And Spider Jerusalem, the only man who might accomplish this goal, is currently being hunted in his own city! "Headlong" part 3.
summary.name: Headlong: Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #056 (2002-07-01) - Headlong- Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: Martial law is expanding out from the Reclamation Zone to take control of the City; martial law runs from the White House and a President savaged by Spider Jerusalem. The beginnings of unrest stir, and no one really knows exactly how the Smiler will react. "Headlong" part 2.
summary.name: Headlong: Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #055 (2002-06-01) - Headlong- One of Three.cbr

summary.description: "Headlong" part 1! The White House has utilized its emergency powers still in place over the City and introduced martial law! Federal controls are quietly being placed over the media; controls they usually roll over for. And it's all Spider Jerusalem's fault!
summary.name: Headlong: One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #054 (2002-05-01) - The Cure- Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: Spider and the Filthy Assistants shelter the most dangerous person in the City: the last surviving eyewitness and participant in the President's use of prostitutes...and therefore the last link between him and a wave of assassinations! "The Cure" concludes.
summary.name: The Cure: Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #053 (2002-04-01) - The Cure- Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: She's the last surviving witness to presidential sexual misconduct. And the only thing between her and a bullet in the brain is a crazed journalist with a degenerative brain disease, a drug habit that could kill a pack of rhinos, and the physical strength of a small, drunken rat. "The Cure" part 2.
summary.name: The Cure: Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #052 (2002-03-01) - The Cure- One of Three.cbr

summary.description: "The Cure" part 1! Spider has identified the prostitutes sent to the Hotel Fat to service Gary Callahan during his campaign. One of their pimps is dead. One of them is hiding. And the girls have no protection whatsoever from a President moving to clear away the evidence of his every indiscretion.
summary.name: The Cure: One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #051 (2002-01-01) - Two-Fisted Editor.cbr

summary.description: Mitchell Royce is stressed. He's stressed because he's been reminded by Spider Jerusalem of what journalism means. And because, since the corruption at the Word swelled up to take them both down, he's been digging for dirt--and now, he's got it.
summary.name: Two-Fisted Editor

name: Transmetropolitan #050 (2001-12-01) - Happy Talk.cbr

summary.description: Spider hits place after place and person after person on a mission to rebuild his case and bring down the President. It all culminates in a final conversation with Fred--and the things he knows might just turn the tide for Spider and his crew.
summary.name: Happy Talk

name: Transmetropolitan #049 (2001-11-01) - Here Comes the Sun.cbr

summary.description: Spider's evidence against the Smiler and his corrupt administration has been wiped out. Now he must rebuild his case from scratch, exploring every nook and cranny...and fighting dirty if he has to - because he's finally up against someone with the mind and ability to fight dirtier than he can. As the nation and City reel under its new shocks, and the Smiler relaxes, Spider and his Filthy Asistants finally have the space to move unnoticed, as they plan their attack.
summary.name: Here Comes the Sun

name: Transmetropolitan #048 (2001-10-01) - Running Out.cbr

summary.description: Spider has the worst deadline in the world; if he doesn't get the Smiler within a year, he won't be able to get him at all. The beginning of TRANSMET's final year is all laid out here. And the only way Spider's going to leave this series is as a winner--or dead.
summary.name: Running Out

name: Transmetropolitan #047 (2001-09-01) - Wants His Face on the Dollar Bill.cbr

summary.description: The City has been designated a disaster zone and disaster zones are always visited by presidents. For the first time since the election, President Gary Callahan and Spider Jerusalem will come face to face once again!
summary.name: Wants His Face on the Dollar Bill

name: Transmetropolitan #046 (2001-08-01) - What I Know.cbr

summary.description: In the aftermath of "Dirge," the City's guts are all over its streets--everything is in chaos and terrible secrets have been revealed. What we learn here will make the next year a desperate rush, because Spider needs to win, and dead men don't win anything.
summary.name: What I Know

name: Transmetropolitan #045 (2001-06-01) - Dirge- Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: There's a story not getting told because the media's ground to a halt. The cops are nowhere to be seen. It's a conspiracy. And the only people who can tell it are outlaw journalists Spider Jerusalem and his filthy assistants. But they may not get the chance! "Dirge" Part 3.
summary.name: Dirge: Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #044 (2001-05-01) - Dirge- Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: Lunatics are on the streets, unchecked by a seemingly absent police force. This would be one of the biggest stories in the City's history—if the Print District hadn't been turned into Sniper Alley! "Dirge" Part 2.
summary.name: Dirge: Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #043 (2001-04-01) - Dirge- One of Three.cbz

summary.description: "Out Loud" Part 1 of 3. The Smiler is operating on the American Constitution. Civic Center is remaking the City in the image of his New Politics. Some anonymous freak is turning a Print District street into Sniper Alley. And Spider Jerusalem is having black-outs and episodes of mental confusion that are not related to his usual diet of narcotics and whiskey. Things are going very wrong. And they're going to get worse before they get better...if they get better.
summary.name: Dirge: One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #042 (2001-03-01) - Spider's Trash.cbr

summary.description: "Streets at Night," Part 3. Tag along for an episode of real-time writing as Spider thrashes the pavement on his walkabout, reciting his latest column. Through seedy downtown alleys, and at every junction, corner and churchyard, he maps the human topography of the City -- the lives upon which it's built.
summary.name: Spider's Trash

name: Transmetropolitan #041 (2001-02-01) - There Is A Reason.cbr

summary.description: The second of three stand-alone issues, Spider Jerusalem gets a whole new take on the world, courtesy of the untreated mental patients spat back into the street by a collapsing healthcare system!
summary.name: There Is A Reason

name: Transmetropolitan #040 (2001-01-01) - Business.cbr

summary.description:
In a stand-alone issue, after witness two young children propositioning a passerby, Spider takes a deep and unflinching look at the disturbing world of child prostitution—and is left, as he rarely is, disarmed.

Spider takes an unflinching look at prostitution, and is left, as he rarely is, disarmed.
summary.name: Business

name: Transmetropolitan #039 (2000-12-01) - Back To Basics- Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: The conclusion of to "Back to Basics!" Tensions have risen in The City as anger burns in the political power structure. Revolution fever sparks in the underground and police brutality increases on the streets. Which means that Spider Jerusalem is unchained, crazy with freedom...and completely in his element!
summary.name: Back To Basics: Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #038 (2000-11-01) - Back To Basics- Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: Fired from his big City newspaper, Spider is now an Outlaw Journalist on the loose, pumping out rants and broadsides for a rogue feed-site. As far as the Powers That Be are concerned, Spider's the most dangerous man alive. "Back to Basics" Part 2!
summary.name: Back To Basics: Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #037 (2000-10-01) - Back To Basics- One of Three.cbr

summary.description: Year Four begins with "Back to Basics" Part 1! No longer employed by The Word, Spider Jerusalem is back on the street without insurance, income or credit cards. So why is he laughing?
summary.name: Back To Basics: One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #036 (2000-09-01) - Gouge Away Part Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: It's the mind and typewriter of Spider Jerusalem versus the media, the money and the White House--and it all comes tumbling down for one of them. Right here, the rules are changed, the arena is altered, and the stakes are everything, launching us into the high-octane Year Four. "Gouge Away" part the end.
summary.name: Gouge Away Part Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #035 (2000-08-01) - Gouge Away Part Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: There's only one thing worse than a drunken, drug-abusing and half-mad journalist--and that's a drunken drug-abusing half-mad journalist who knows how to do his job and is out to destroy your life. This is Spider Jerusalem on the offensive: angry and blisteringly smart, one step ahead of the White House spin doctors, going all out to eviscerate the President himself. "Gouge Away" part 2.
summary.name: Gouge Away Part Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #034 (2000-07-01) - Gouge Away- Part One of Three.cbr

summary.description: Part 1 of the 3-part "Gouge Away." And it all goes to hell, just like this: Spider Jerusalem's broadsides against the Smiler and the Party in Government intensify. He starts to sail very close to the edge; the forces of the monoculture gather themselves; and we begin to sense it's all going to end in tears. From here, everything changes.
summary.name: Gouge Away: Part One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #033 (2000-05-01) - Dancing in The Here and Now.cbr

summary.description: A self-contained issue featuring a cover by Jaime Hernandez (Penny Century, Love and Rockets). While a brooding and hate-maddened Spider Jerusalem lays his evil plans for the future in the dark depths of his high-rise bunker, his ""filthy assistants"" see their chance for escape. Channon Yarrow and Yelena Rossini grab themselves a few moments of sanity in the sun, a stolen bit of calm before the storm.
summary.name: Dancing in The Here and Now

name: Transmetropolitan #032 (2000-04-01) - The Walk.cbr

summary.description: A self-contained issue featuring a cover by Jaime Hernandez (Penny Century, Love and Rockets). Spider Jerusalem is sick of being under the government's thumb. So when "someone hacks" his computer and submits a blacklisted column to The Hole, he's ready to give interviews...
summary.name: The Walk

name: Transmetropolitan #031 (2000-03-01) - Nobody Loves Me.cbr

summary.description: A brooding Spider Jerusalem turns to the one drug he knows will relieve his melancholy: television. In his altered state, the horrors of TV seem even worse than usual--especially when he sees that he's been made cuddly by the media. This issue features stories illustrated by Frank Quitely (ALL-STAR SUPERMAN), Eduardo Risso (100 BULLETS) and more!
summary.name: Nobody Loves Me

name: Transmetropolitan #030 (2000-02-01) - Lonely City, Three of Three.cbr

summary.description: The conclusion of the 3-part ""Lonely City""! Has Spider Jerusalem finally dug too deep for the truth? With a district in flames, people shooting at him and a newspaper in chaos, Spider has discovered that everything he's been investigating has been orchestrated by the one person he can't get to...
summary.name: Lonely City, Three of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #029 (2000-01-01) - Lonely City, Two of Three.cbr

summary.description: Something is rotten in the central City, and it's probably journalist Spider Jerusalem. Digging for the truth behind the child slaying/police negligence story he dug up--a story that has the City on the edge of massive riots--what he finds embroils him and his assistants in chaos, fire and death!
summary.name: Lonely City, Two of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #028 (1999-12-01) - Lonely City, One of Three.cbr

summary.description: Part 1 of the 3-part "Lonely City." When a teenager is killed, the police department's lackluster response sends a City district into an uproar. Outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem smells a nasty story, but his investigations threaten to ignite the worst riots in City history.
summary.name: Lonely City, One of Three

name: Transmetropolitan #027 (1999-11-01) - Monstering!.cbr

summary.description: The third of 3 self-contained issues finds Spider Jerusalem sharing the tricks of his trade. Spider decides to teach his "filthy assistants" the fine journalistic art of "monstering"--to hound, abuse, interrogate and otherwise ruin the life of a public figure in the name of journalism.
summary.name: Monstering!

name: Transmetropolitan #026 (1999-10-01) - 21 Days in the City.cbr

summary.description: "21 Days in the City" features Spider Jerusalem's anger-charged prose in a series of excerpts from his newspaper columns, all illustrated by Darick Robertson. The result is a disturbing look at life in the City (and the world) of the future.
summary.name: 21 Days in the City

name: Transmetropolitan #025 (1999-09-01) - Here To Go.cbr

summary.description: The acclaimed series explodes into its third year with the first of 3 self-contained issues. ""Here to Go"" is a savage, funny focus on outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem, as he tells stories of his past that illuminate his obsessions with power, terrorism and especially death.
summary.name: Here To Go

name: Transmetropolitan #024 (1999-08-01) - The New Scum 6- New Scum.cbr

summary.description: The New Scum concludes with a drunken bang as Spider Jerusalem holds a depraved election-night party as the future of the nation is decided. It's the Smiler vs. the Beast, winner-take-all--and covering the political madness as usual is Spider, determined to write the truth no matter what.
summary.name: The New Scum 6: New Scum

name: Transmetropolitan #023 (1999-07-01) - The New Scum 5- New Boss.cbr

summary.description: Spider Jerusalem conducts a shocking interview with The Smiler--the grinning opposition candidate who hopes to become President. But there's a bite behind that smile, and even Spider may not be able to dodge its deadly teeth.
summary.name: The New Scum 5: New Boss

name: Transmetropolitan #022 (1999-06-01) - The New Scum 4- New Streets.cbr

summary.description:
Spider Jerusalem's investigation of Vita Severn's murder heats up as he takes to the street, discovering that a bizarre cult has grown up around her memory.

Spider gives Mary a camera as a gift.
summary.name: The New Scum 4: New Streets

name: Transmetropolitan #021 (1999-05-01) - The New Scum 3- New President.cbr

summary.description:
It's part interview, part interrogation and part steel-cage wrestling match in this self-contained chapter of ''The New Scum.'' Underground journalist Spider Jerusalem goes head-to-head with the President of the United States! Will they be carried out on stretchers--or become best friends?

Spider and the Beast have a surprisingly candid, albeit tense, discussion. Spider comes to realize that as despicable as the Beast is, he's still not as bad as the Smiler.
summary.name: The New Scum 3: New President

name: Transmetropolitan #020 (1999-04-01) - The New Scum 2- New City.cbr

summary.description:
Outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem, his team, and their City have all had enough of politics. Now, Spider stops to look at the City and the effects the last few months have wrought upon it. And in those quiet moments, the election takes its weirdest turn yet, chewing up Spider's life for good...

The Beast demands that Spider interview him.
summary.name: The New Scum 2: New City

name: Transmetropolitan #019 (1999-03-01) - The New Scum 1- New Home.cbr

summary.description:
Part 1 of the 6-part ''The New Scum.'' Spider Jerusalem is now content; he's got his assistant, he's got his bodyguard, and he's the voice of the New Scum--the newly disenfranchised class of the City. Yes, Spider's too happy. He must be up to something...

Channon and Yelena discover Spider's photos of Spider and Yelena having sex. Also, Spider decides to start investigating Vita Severn's murder.
summary.name: The New Scum 1: New Home

name: Transmetropolitan #018 (1999-02-01) - Year of the Bastard 6- Bastard.cbr

summary.description:
In the shocking conclusion to the 6-part ''Year of the Bastard,'' outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem cracks the secret of the mysterious Vice-Presidential candidate. It may well be his finest moment as a reporter, but Spider's expose will lead to a horrific--and very personal--climax.

Year of the Bastard, Part 6.

Spider begins practicing investigative journalism, something that is virtually unknown in the society he lives in. After he finds proof of his suspicions, he decides to confront the Smiler. Channon returns after discovering that life as a nun in the Church of Fred Christ wasn't particularly fulfilling, plus she's dug up some great dirt on The Smiler's campaign.. After confronting the Smiler, the Smiler's approval rating plummets and it seems like his campaign is over. Then, Spider's good friend Vita Severn, the Smiler's political director, is assassinated on live television. The Smiler's approval rating consequently gets a huge sympathy boost.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard 6: Bastard

name: Transmetropolitan #017 (1999-01-01) - Year of the Bastard 5- Love.cbr

summary.description:
The newly famous Spider deals with a disquieting turn in his personal life as the election heats up to a fever pitch. The result: Spider prepares for a last-ditch campaign of sabotage.

Part 5 of Year of the Bastard

Spider and Yelena wake up in bed together. Both are initially horrified and Yelena tries to convince Spider that nothing happened. Spider and Yelena attend the convention, where the Smiler is chosen as the next presidential candidate. Spider is initially elated, then horrified to discover that he has pictures proving he and Yelena had sex the previous night. Later, the Smiler appoints his running mate. When he chooses someone Spider has never heard of, Spider suspects the worst and decides he will do whatever it takes to destroy the Smiler's campaign.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard 5: Love

name: Transmetropolitan #016 (1998-12-01) - Year of the Bastard 4- Hate.cbr

summary.description:
Having achieved newfound fame as a writer, a desperate, barely functional Spider Jerusalem retreats from the public eye...and we learn why he left the City years ago.

Part 4 of Year of the Bastard

Spider's book has been released, granting him plenty of (unwanted) popularity. Frustrated and slightly maddened by the crowds of fans following him, Spider leads them to one of the worst parts of the City. Using the horror of the area, Spider tries to convince the watchers to vote the Beast out of office.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard 4: Hate

name: Transmetropolitan #015 (1998-11-01) - Year of the Bastard 3- Smile.cbr

summary.description:
As outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem throws the presidential election into chaos, his new assistant takes a few shots at him, and Senator Bob Heller makes his terrifying bid for power in ''Year of the Bastard'' part 3.

Part 3 of Year of the Bastard

Spider's column excoriating the Smiler has caused his approval rating to plummet, but when the Smiler's political director Vita Severn approaches him to ask for his help, he wavers. Impressed and smitten by the beautiful and intelligent Dr. Severn, Spider decides that maybe the most important thing is getting the Beast out of office. Spider writes a new column indirectly (and sarcastically) giving his approval to the Smiler.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard 3: Smile

name: Transmetropolitan #014 (1998-10-01) - Year of the Bastard 2- Badmouth.cbr

summary.description: Spider gets a new assistant. He also meets "The Smiler," the man who may just be able to win the election against "The Beast." Spider senses the hatred and bleakness deep within the Smiler and decides he's no better than the Beast.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard 2: Badmouth

name: Transmetropolitan #013 (1998-09-01) - Year of the Bastard.cbr

summary.description:
It's election year, and a reluctant, reclusive Spider Jerusalem has sunk even deeper inside himself. Now he's more determined than ever to cover the ugly political dogfight, fulfill his book contracts, and get the hell out of the City in part 1 of the 6-part ''Year of the Bastard.''

Spider decides to start covering the upcoming election, but he's not sure if the challenger has what it takes to get "The Beast" out of office.
summary.name: Year of the Bastard

name: Transmetropolitan #012 (1998-08-01) - Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part III of III.cbr

summary.description:
In the conclusion to the 3-part "Freeze Me with Your Kiss," the secret of Spider's wife--whose cryogenically frozen head has been stolen--is revealed, and the mad police dog Stomponato gets his.

Spider figures out most of the reasons for the strange things happening to him and comes up with an unusual way to resolve the situation.
summary.name: Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part III of III

name: Transmetropolitan #011 (1998-07-01) - Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part II of III.cbr

summary.description:
Part 2 of the 3-part "Freeze Me with Your Kiss." Stripped of his credit cards, newsfeeds, and journalist's insurance, a desperate Spider Jerusalem takes to the cold streets--hunted by the vengeful police dog Stompanato, whom Spider once had "fixed."

Spider has locked himself in a public toilet to hide from the police and specifically, the psychotic police dog with a personal vendetta against him. Things continue to get worse, however, when strange people begin cutting their way into the stall.
summary.name: Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part II of III

name: Transmetropolitan #010 (1998-06-01) - Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part I of III.cbr

summary.description:
Part 1 of the 3-part "Freeze Me with Your Kiss," the climax to TRANSMETROPOLITAN's first year. The cryogenically frozen head of Spider's ex-wife is stolen, his newspaper receives a threat on his life, and a mentally unstable police dog swears revenge on him. And that's only the beginning...

Strange things are happening to Spider. His wife's head has been stolen, three men tried to kill him, and he's on the run from the law for not having insurance. To make matters slightly worse, a headless child has shown up, claiming to be his son.
summary.name: Freeze Me with Your Kiss, Part I of III

name: Transmetropolitan #009 (1998-05-01) - Wild in the Country.cbr

summary.description:
In this self-contained issue, outlaw journalist Spider Jerusalem investigates the Reservations, an area where previous cultures are carefully maintained in stasis, and discovers a place where an entirely new culture is being developed around body modification. Plus: Spider tries to ask a woman out...

Spider goes on a tour of the Reservations, places dedicated to preserving old Earth cultures. In general, he is impressed. Also, Channon decides to leave to become a nun.
summary.name: Wild in the Country

name: Transmetropolitan #008 (1998-04-01) - Another Cold Morning.cbr

summary.description:
In the self-contained "Another Cold Morning," Spider Jerusalem, outlaw journalist, walks with the Revivals--people who have come out from cryogenic freeze into a world they don't understand, clinging to life in a city that has forgotten them completely.

Spider discusses the Revivals, people who have been revived from cryogenic storage after long periods of time. Almost all Revivals are unable to deal with the modern world and are generally ignored by the public. Spider makes friends with one Revival, a photojournalist from the 20th century named Mary.
summary.name: Another Cold Morning

name: Transmetropolitan #007 (1998-03-01) - Boyfriend is a Virus.cbr

summary.description:
In the first of three self-contained stories exploring different subcultures in the City, an acquaintance of Spider Jerusalem's opts to have his consciousness downloaded, so Spider watches him and discovers the bizarre, insular community of posthuman "foglets."

Spider tries to help his assistant Channon come to terms with her boyfriend's decision to transfer his consciousness into a sentient nanite cloud.
summary.name: Boyfriend is a Virus

name: Transmetropolitan #006 (1998-02-01) - God Riding Shotgun.cbr

summary.description: In a self-contained story, crusading journalist Spider Jerusalem is thrust into the world of bizarre religious movements that have sprung up during his five-year absence from The City.  But Spider's bad attitude makes him an unlikely convert, even to the most fervent evangelists alive.
summary.name: God Riding Shotgun

name: Transmetropolitan #005 (1998-01-01) - What Spider Watches on TV.cbr

summary.description:
In this self-contained issue, journalist Spider Jerusalem watches TV, alternating between (1.) violent reactions to what's considered entertainment in his City, and (2.) an apathetic state bordering on decomposition.

Spider decides to spend the whole day watching television, claiming it will help him better understand the residents of the City. After several hours of aimless channel surfing and buying products he sees in commercials, Spider discovers the wonder of call-in shows. However, when the chaos he is causing starts making the news, Spider is forced to realize the horrible truth: he has become television.
summary.name: What Spider Watches on TV

name: Transmetropolitan #004 (1997-12-01) - On the Stump.cbr

summary.description:
In the first of three self-contained issues, Spider is drawn into The City's corrupt political arena, leading to a terrible confrontation with the President of the United States...in a men's room. And Spider is assigned an assistant to keep him in line--but she's not what he expects.

The issue begins with Spider naked and writing (possibly never a good sign), He's then interrupted by his boss who wants his column now, Spider tells him to get off and that the column isn't due until a few days anyway. It's at that point, his boss tells him he's getting an assistant, he gets quite mad about that and stands up to go blast what he thinks will be some punk kid he can't work with with his Bowel Disruptor, but when he gets there...it's Channon Yarrow, an ex-stripper whom he had met before.

The two exchange a few brief words (basically Spider telling her everything he wants her to do), She comes back sometime later...this time, Spider's wearing pants. They discuss the world and more-so Spider's odd views on it as well as journalism etc.

Soon enough, the TV comes on with a message that the president will be coming to town. Spider immediately shouts out "LETS GO SEE THE PRESIDENT".

Spider and Channon then go out to town, he manages to get into the Presidents address and it isn't long before Spider snoops around and finds the president BEFORE the address..in the rest room of all places.

He's mumbling to himself about cheap Australian whores and having hard time peeing when Spider walks in, the two get into a war of words that eventually ends with Spider throwing him into a stall and using the "Bowel Disruptor" on him..set to "Prolapse".

Spider walks out and tells Channon they need to leave.

"Why?" she asked.

"HELP! THE PRESIDENT'S SHAT HIMSELF!" the Secret Service cried out.

Then Channon and Spider leave.
summary.name: On the Stump

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #006 (2011-01-01) - Everything That Happens Will Happen Today.cbz

summary.description: Has the menace of the Dero robots been eliminated? Have Tom Strong and Albrecht returned to the present day? What happened to Dr. Permafrost? Will Tesla and Val ever get married? Join Peter Hogan and Chris Sprouse as they answer all these questions and more in our mind-bending finale!
summary.name: Everything That Happens Will Happen Today

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #005 (2010-12-01) - Two Tribes.cbz

summary.description: It's war beneath the world, as Tom Strong and his motley army of allies face off against Tom's Nazi son Albrecht and a horde of killer robots. As fighting rages in the Dero caverns miles under the surface, can Tom find a way to overcome incredible odds and save the Earth from a Fascist future? Who will survive, and who will fall on the battlefield?
summary.name: Two Tribes

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #004 (2010-11-01) - By Lava's Lamp.cbr

summary.description: With his 1940s counterpart a helpless captive of the Robots of Doom, Tom Strong has no choice but to ally himself with his most bitter enemy in order to defeat his own evil son. But where can Strong and Dr. Permafrost recruit an army powerful enough to prevent the Nazi domination of the Earth? Where else but the heart of a volcano!
summary.name: By Lava's Lamp

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #003 (2010-10-01) - Part Three- Caving In.cbz

summary.description: Tom Strong has traveled back to 1939 and he's racing to prevent his evil son from recruiting an army that will allow the Nazis to conquer the world - the unstoppable Robots of Doom! Accompanied by his younger self, Tom faces a fatal showdown in the caverns of the Dero robots and is forced to seek aid from one of his deadliest enemies!
summary.name: Part Three: Caving In

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #002 (2010-09-01) - Part Two- The Tom-Tom Club.cbr

summary.description: The adventure continues as one of Alan Moore's most beloved creations returns to comics! Tom Strong's life is in ruins, his family is dead and the Nazis have gained total world domination by exploiting a secret from his past. To overthrow his evil son Albrecht and restore the world he knew, Tom must find a way to journey back in time and seek help from the only man he can trust: himself! But will even two Tom Strongs be a match for the Robots of Doom?
summary.name: Part Two: The Tom/Tom Club

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom #001 (2010-08-01) - Part One- Black Sun Rising.cbr

summary.description: The super sci-fi adventure continues as one of Alan Moore's most beloved creations returns to comics with ABC veteran Peter Hogan (TERRA OBSCURA) writing and co-creator Chris Sprouse pencilling! Tom Strong and his family prepare to celebrate Tesla's wedding when the unthinkable happens – before their eyes, reality alters to become a world conquered by the Nazis and ruled by Tom's nefarious son Albrecht! What mysterious secret from Tom's past has brought about this catastrophe? And how can things ever be put right again? Featuring a variant cover by fellow ABC alumnus J.H. Williams III (DETECTIVE COMICS, PROMETHEA)!
summary.name: Part One: Black Sun Rising

volume.name: Tom Strong and the Robots of Doom

name: Terra Obscura #006 (2005-05-14) - Future Now!.cbr

summary.description: It all comes down to this: a showdown in space! The only thing standing between the Terror's seizure of Colonel Future's time-warping ship is Tom Strange. But is he powerful enough to stop this monstrosity? Could this be the end of Terra Obscura as we know it?
summary.name: Future Now!

name: Terra Obscura #005 (2005-03-14) - Prisoners of Infinity!.cbr

summary.description: Tom Strange and Princess Pantha face dire peril in the depths of space at the hands of The Terror! And on the planet, S.M.A.S.H. must contend with the deadliest time anomaly of all: an atomic bomb headed toward Hiroshima, meant to end World War II!
summary.name: Prisoners of Infinity!

name: Terra Obscura #004 (2005-01-14) - Unfriendly Skies!.cbr

summary.description: Shocking betrayals are revealed as the gripping miniseries continues! Tom Strange finds his plans of reaching the mysterious craft thwarted by a most unexpected source just as the time distortions turn deadly! Pearl Harbor gets attacked again with no warships present and civilians as the target!
summary.name: Unfriendly Skies!

name: Terra Obscura #003 (2004-12-14) - I Was A Teenage Sidekick!.cbr

summary.description: The bizarre time distortions worsen as the mysterious craft nears Terra Obscura. Tom Strange, while preparing to leave Earth, comes into contact with some old allies...and one nasty villain!
summary.name: I Was A Teenage Sidekick!

name: Terra Obscura #002 (2004-11-14) - S.M.A.S.H. Of Two Worlds!.cbr

summary.description: The miniseries continues! With a mysterious craft nearing the planet, the Pentagon decides upon the only non-military solution they have: send Tom Strange into space to investigate! As preparations for the journey begin, more time fluctuations occur...including the appearance of the S.M.A.S.H. of yesteryear!
summary.name: S.M.A.S.H. Of Two Worlds!

name: Terra Obscura #001 (2004-10-14) - The World's Best.cbr

summary.description: Tom Strange and the heroes of Terra Obscura return for another outing following 2003's critically acclaimed series! The heroes have finally adjusted to the society that spent 30-years without them...and more importantly, society has acclimated to having science heroes again! Things have returned to normal for the members of S.M.A.S.H., until a mysterious object appears on the edge of their galaxy — on a collision course with Terra Obscura! What’s more, the object appears to be the spacecraft of long-lost legendary hero Captain Future, but in a twisted and distorted way. And as the ship nears, time anomalies begin to crop up over the entire planet, wreaking terrible havok. Can Tom Strong and the other heroes unravel this mystery before it spells doom for the entire planet?
summary.name: The World's Best

name: Terra Obscura #006 (2004-02-14) - The Weighing Of The Heart.cbr

summary.description: The thrilling miniseries concludes with an oversized final issue! It all comes down to this, as our gallant heroes confront the source of the null field...and it's not what anyone expects! Will our valiant heroes survive the encounter?
summary.name: The Weighing Of The Heart

name: Terra Obscura #005 (2003-12-14) - Valley Of The Shadow.cbr

summary.description: The pieces fall into place as the heroes draw near the Grand Canyon. The Scarab and the Liberator must battle Dr. X's powers of illusion while Tom Strange and company make their way up from the South Pole. But what is the source of the null force sweeping the United States?
summary.name: Valley Of The Shadow

name: Terra Obscura #004 (2003-11-14) - The Man Who Killed The Future.cbr

summary.description: S.M.A.S.H.'s return to action has been anything but glorious, as our heroes' advance has been foiled by the null field! Meanwhile, the hunt for Tom Strange takes the Invertica City gang to the coldest reaches of Earth.
summary.name: The Man Who Killed The Future

name: Terra Obscura #003 (2003-10-14) - Wipeout.cbr

summary.description: The Null Zone sweeping across the Western United States and disrupting all electrical devices has been deemed a National Emergency. And the President has reunited S.M.A.S.H.! Will the science heroes be able to stop this perplexing phenomenon? Meanwhile, other heroes are reunited in Invertica City, and the hunt for Tom Strange begins. But where do you begin to look for someone who vanished years ago?
summary.name: Wipeout

name: Tom Strong #036 (2006-05-01) - Tom Strong at the End of the World.cbr

summary.description: It's "Tom Strong at the End of the World" as Alan Moore and Chris Sprouse reunite for one final, breathtaking story! The events of the last several issues of PROMETHEA are recalled as our hero ? and special guest stars Jack B. Quick, Greyshirt, Splash Brannigan, The Cobweb, Jonni Future, and many others, discover what happens when the world comes to an end. But that's all small potatoes compared to the really big news revealed within these pages! Final issue.
summary.name: Tom Strong at the End of the World

name: Tom Strong #035 (2006-01-01) - Cold Calling.cbr

summary.description: A sequel to the Snow Queen story from TOM STRONG #24! Ice people are on the loose in Millennium, and they're robbing banks! Could Greta Gabriel's heart have grown so cold?
summary.name: Cold Calling

name: Tom Strong #034 (2005-10-01) - The Spires of Samakhara.cbr

summary.description: Big trouble in central China! Tom lends a hand after a nuclear detonation in central Asia but discovers a spired city in which unusual dangers abound, as well as a lovely adventuress. What does all this have to do with a bizarre children's book written more than 100 years earlier?
summary.name: The Spires of Samakhara

name: Tom Strong #033 (2005-08-01) - The Journey Within.cbr

summary.description: When Pneuman begins a pattern of strange behavior, Tom Strong and Solomon undertake one of their most amazing adventures ? a "Fantastic Journey" that takes them from the spires of Millennium City to the cold heart of a robot!
summary.name: The Journey Within

name: Tom Strong #032 (2005-06-01) - The Black Blade of the Barbary Coast, Part 2.cbr

summary.description: The conclusion of a thrilling 2-part story by legendary author Michael Moorcock and artist Jerry Ordway! Tom Strong and Solomon are recruited on a mission to save the multiverse. But has their information been tainted?. Are they really working on the side of the angels? And who is the mysterious Count Zodiac?
summary.name: The Black Blade of the Barbary Coast, Part 2

name: Tom Strong #031 (2005-04-01) - The Black Blade of the Barbary Coast, Part 1.cbr

summary.description: Part 1 of a 2-issue tale written by master science-fiction storyteller Michael Moorcock (ELRIC: THE MAKING OF A SORCERER, Mother London) with art by Jerry Ordway (SUPERMAN, TOM STRONG)! A famed Metatemporal Investigator, or Time 'Tec, enlists the aid of Tom Strong to save the multiverse. Together with Solomon and Pneuman, they must travel back through time, across the Moonbeam Roads that bridge the multiverse, to find the one responsible for this dire threat: Count Zodiac!
summary.name: The Black Blade of the Barbary Coast, Part 1

name: Tom Strong #030 (2005-02-01) - The Terrible True Life of Tom Strong, Part 2.cbr

summary.description: The conclusion of "The Terrible Life of Tom Strong!" Tom Strong, hero of Millennium City, is no more. One day Tom wakes up to discover he's a middle-aged man in a loveless marriage, working at a meaningless job. Will this new direction be any closer to our own version of Tom Strong?
summary.name: The Terrible True Life of Tom Strong, Part 2

name: Tom Strong #029 (2004-12-01) - The Terrible True Life of Tom Strong, Part 1.cbr

summary.description: Part 1 of a fantastic 2-part story by two of comics' most exciting creators! Tom Strong's feats of bravery are world-renowned, but what if he weren't an idol to millions? If he didn't ascend to the role of hero, where would he be?
summary.name: The Terrible True Life of Tom Strong, Part 1

name: Tom Strong #028 (2004-11-01) - A Fire In His Belly.cbr

summary.description: Featuring the guest creative team of Brian K. Vaughan (Y: THE LAST MAN, EX MACHINA) and Cameron Stewart (SEAGUY)! Tom's faithful robot servant Pneuman questions himself. Has he fulfilled the duty assigned him by Susan Strong all those years ago?
summary.name: A Fire In His Belly

name: Tom Strong #027 (2004-09-01) - Jenny Panic and the Bible of Dreams.cbr

summary.description: A surreal journey of self-discovery brought to you by British science fiction author Steve Aylett (Karloff's Circus) and fan-favorite artist Shawn McManus (THE SANDMAN PRESENTS: THESSALY, WITCH FOR HIRE). Several mysterious deaths, coupled by an unannounced visit from an enigmatic stranger, prompt Tom Strong to investigate a woman with odd powers that shift realities.
summary.name: Jenny Panic and the Bible of Dreams

name: Tom Strong #026 (2004-07-01) - The Day Tom Strong Renegotiated the Friendly Skies.cbz

summary.description: Buckle up for a high-flying tale that takes Tom and his companions from the back streets of Millennium City to the top of the world! Aircraft across the world are mysteriously grounded as all engine- driven flight is rendered impossible. Now, after discovering a secret from his past, Tom Strong must solve this mystery, or mankind will forever be banned from the skies! Featuring guest creative team Mark Schultz (Cadillacs and Dinosaurs) and Pascual Ferry (SUPERMAN).
summary.name: The Day Tom Strong Renegotiated the Friendly Skies

name: Tom Strong #025 (2004-05-01) - Tom Strong's Pal, Wally Willoughby.cbr

summary.description: A spectacular 25th issue celebration written by Geoff Johns (TEEN TITANS) with art by John-Paul Leon (Earth X)! Tom Strong, the champion of Millennium City, is many things to many people: hero, nemesis, husband, father. But when a series of unlikely and inexplicable occurrences happen in seemingly random order, Tom must don a new hat, that of best friend. How will this affect the occasionally standoffish hero? Guest-starring the Strongmen of America!
summary.name: Tom Strong's Pal, Wally Willoughby

name: Tom Strong #024 (2004-03-01) - Snow Queen.cbr

summary.description: Greta Gabriel, Tom Strong's ill-fated lover, died in 1928, the result of a cryogenics experiment gone awry. Or did she? More than 70 years later, an accident uncovers the body of his lost love, and while she may be stone cold, she's still alive. Now Tom, guilt-ridden over what happened to Greta, must help her fit into the 21st century!
summary.name: Snow Queen

name: Tom Strong #023 (2004-01-01) - Moonday.cbr

summary.description: A major new revelation in the Tom Strong mythos! Tom Strong, Tesla, and her boyfriend Val head to the moon on a rescue mission at the request of Russian Science-Hero Svetlana-X. Their quarry: her husband Dimitri, a missing Cosmonaut. But as they search for the missing hero, the quiet grandeur of the moon is shattered by the sudden kidnapping of one of their party!
summary.name: Moonday

name: Tom Strong #022 (2003-12-01) - How Tom Stone Got Started- Chapter Three - Crisis In Infinite Hearts.cbr

summary.description:
The 3-part "How Tom Stone Got Started" comes to a tragic conclusion! This new world has fallen to dark, sad depths. Sides are chosen, battle lines are drawn, family and friends are torn apart. It's a world that one woman desperately tries to prevent from ever existing.

Notes:

  • The cover is a homage to the cover of Crisis on Infinite Earths #7.
summary.name: How Tom Stone Got Started: Chapter Three - Crisis In Infinite Hearts

name: Tom Strong #021 (2003-10-01) - How Tom Stone Got Started- Chapter Two - Strongmen In Silvertime.cbr

summary.description: Part 2 of an epic 3-part tale delving into the strange but familiar world of Tom Stone! In the middle of the century, Tom Stone and Paul Saveen are engaged in a tremendous battle...standing side by side, brothers-in-arms amidst a science-hero civil war! It's all-out war as the Strongmen of America take on America's Best!
summary.name: How Tom Stone Got Started: Chapter Two - Strongmen In Silvertime

name: Tom Strong #020 (2003-06-01) - How Tom Stone Got Started- Chapter One.cbr

summary.description: Part 1 of an exciting new epic 3-part adventure! "What might have been" - just four melancholy words that conjure so many emotions. Four words that suddenly take on new meaning when Tom Strong learns what would have happened - who he would be - if things had been a fraction different. Journey back to the last days of the 19th century, to a time before Tom Strong was born, and learn what can happen in the blink of an eye…in a tale called "How Tom Stone Got Started!"
summary.name: How Tom Stone Got Started: Chapter One

name: Tom Strong #019 (2003-04-01) - Electric Ladyland!; Bad To The Bone; The Hero-Hoard Of Horatio Hogg!.cbz

summary.description: A trio of tales in this issue, including a look at the final days of Tom Strong's arch-villain, Saveen, illustrated by Shawn McManus. Plus, Tom takes a wild romp through the 1970s courtesy of artist Howard Chaykin. And artist Chris Sprouse brings it all home with a story of Tom in the present.
summary.name: Electric Ladyland!; Bad To The Bone; The Hero-Hoard Of Horatio Hogg!

name: Tom Strong #018 (2002-12-01) - The Last Roundup.cbr

summary.description: It's the startling conclusion to our 3-part epic adventure! Tom Strong, along with the Weird Rider and the Family Strong, fight a raging battle against a fearsome and brutal invasion force. Guest-starring many of Tom's allies from the past. This is not an issue to be missed!
summary.name: The Last Roundup

name: Tom Strong #017 (2002-08-01) - Ant Fugue!.cbr

summary.description: It's the middle chapter of our grand 3-part extravaganza! Tom Strong, with a little help from some friends, terrestrial and other, is joined by the mysterious Weird Rider to do battle with spaced-out insects intent on turning Earth into a giant anthill!
summary.name: Ant Fugue!

name: Tom Strong #016 (2002-04-01) - Some Call Him The Space Cowboy.cbr

summary.description: Beginning a multi-part storyline that will include the return of some exciting characters from past issues! Featuring the return of the Modular Man, who is now master of Venus, and the Strongmen of America. Plus, the introduction of a mysterious "Space Cowboy" who is on his way to Earth, just ahead of an advancing alien armada. Is he the point guard of an invasion? Or something else?
summary.name: Some Call Him The Space Cowboy

name: Tom Strong #015 (2002-03-01) - Ring Of Fire!.cbz

summary.description: It's the return of the magnificent Val Var Garm, the man of molten lava who so entranced Tesla in issue #8. In this full-length story, Val Var Garm kidnaps Tesla and takes her to his fantastic underground realm. Tom must somehow find a way to rescue her, but does she want to be saved? It's a tale of passion in a story we call "Hearts of Fire!"
summary.name: Ring Of Fire!

name: Tom Strong #014 (2001-10-01) - Space Family Strong; The Land Of Heart's Desire!; Baubles Of The Brain Bazaar!.cbz

summary.description: This issue begins with "Space Family Strong," illustrated by acclaimed artist Hilary Barta, where Tom Strong and company find themselves at the far end of the universe discovering the hazards of space travel. Then fasten your seat belts for another rocket ride when artists Chris Sprouse & Al Gordon explore a different side of the cosmos in which we take a candid glimpse at...Tom and Dhalua's honeymoon!
summary.name: Space Family Strong; The Land Of Heart's Desire!; Baubles Of The Brain Bazaar!

name: Tom Strong #013 (2001-07-01) - The Tower at Time's End!.cbz

summary.description: Tom Strong and family star in a riveting new adventure told in four parts. Joining the Strongs is none other than that Heroic Hare, Warren Strong! And joining Cheerful Chris Sprouse & Animated Al Gordon this issue are some extraordinary guest artists: Kyle Baker, Russ Heath and Peter Poplaski.
summary.name: The Tower at Time's End!

name: Tom Strong #012 (2001-06-01) - Terror on Terra Obscura!.cbr

summary.description: The two-part galaxy-spanning story concludes. Tom Strong travels to the far side of the Milky Way on a desperate mission to save an old friend -- and an entire world. There he faces a menace so huge it defies description.
summary.name: Terror on Terra Obscura!

name: Tom Strong #011 (2001-01-01) - Strange Reunion.cbr

summary.description: Not having slept for thirty years, Tom Strange of Terra Obscura arrives on Tom Strong's Earth in need of dire assistance in "Strange Reunion." Part 1 of 2, continued next issue.
summary.name: Strange Reunion

name: Tom Strong #010 (2000-11-01) - Tom Strong and his Phantom Autogyro; Funnyland!; Too Many Teslas.cbr

summary.description: Who is Warren Strong? Find out in this surprising issue! Gregarious Gary Gianni provides a striking cover and story this time around in an eerily atmospheric tale we call "The Phantom Autogyro From Beyond the Land of the Dead!" Regular series artists Chris Sprouse and Al Gordon grace us with not one but two exciting installments: the first introducing the aforementioned Warren Strong (nope, we're not telling), the second, a solo story starring Tom's daughter, Tesla!
summary.name: Tom Strong and his Phantom Autogyro; Funnyland!; Too Many Teslas?

name: Tom Strong #009 (2000-09-01) - Terror Temple of Tayasal; Volcano Dreams; Flip Attitude!.cbr

summary.description: Three incredible stories, including one illustrated by Concrete's Paul Chadwick, in one great issue! Our latest serving of Strongmania contains a dazzling tale of Tom and his lovely wife Dhalua on the isle of Attabar Teru with art by this month's cover artist, the astonishing Paul Chadwick (GIFTS OF THE NIGHT)! Not only that, but our regular art team supreme Chris Sprouse and Al Gordon supply two complete tales of our muscle-bound mental marvel, his foes, his friends and family.
summary.name: Terror Temple of Tayasal; Volcano Dreams; Flip Attitude!

name: Tom Strong #008 (2000-07-01) - Riders of the Lost Mesa; The Old Skool!; Sparks.cbr

summary.description: It's the wildest West you've ever seen in an issue featuring three stories of America's greatest science hero! Now that Tom's time-twisting adventure is over, guest-artist Alan Weiss (BATMAN: THE BLUE, THE GREY, AND THE BAT, Steelgrip Starkey) comes onboard for this issue's cover and lead story, as Tom and King Solomon put on their spurs and Stetsons to become "Riders of the Lost Mesa!"
summary.name: Riders of the Lost Mesa; The Old Skool!; Sparks

name: Tom Strong #007 (2000-03-01) - Sons and Heirs, Showdown in the Shimmering City.cbr

summary.description:
The conclusion of the 4-part epic that has seen Tom Strong run the gamut of enemies stretching from the primordial past into, with this issue, the staggering future of Millennium City. See the Tom Strong of the 21st century as he battles for his life alongside the Strongmen of America against a foe he cannot beat without destroying himself! See Pneuman, Solomon, Dhalua and Tesla as they will become! Best of all, see fan-favorite Gary Frank's and Cam Smith's incredible take on our triangle-torsoed titan in a stunning 8-page sequence!

Notes:

  • The cover credits Tad Ehrlich as the colorist, but interior colors are by Mike Garcia.
summary.name: Sons and Heirs, Showdown in the Shimmering City

name: Tom Strong #006 (2000-02-01) - Dead Man's Hand, The Big Heat.cbr

summary.description: A special issue featuring a short story reuniting the WATCHMEN team of Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons! Having run a gauntlet of such terrifying enemies as Nazi superwoman Ingrid Weiss and the grotesque sentient slime-mound known as Pangean, Tom must face his greatest foe of all - a hideous revenge coming from beyond the grave - and try to beat the "Dead Man's Hand!" This issue also features an 8-page story written by Alan Moore with art by Dave Gibbons (who also provides a striking cover)!
summary.name: Dead Man's Hand, The Big Heat?

name: Tom Strong #005 (1999-12-01) - Memories of Pangaea, Escape from Eden!.cbz

summary.description: A stunning issue featuring a cover and 8-page interior feature by Jerry Ordway (THE POWER OF SHAZAM!, The Avengers)! Tom Strong is far from home, trapped in the far-distant past and stranded on the Earth's first single continent. It's here our high-tech Hercules must face his oldest foe, the deathless horror that is our world's earliest inhabitant. You won't want to miss Tom Strong's adventures at the Dawn of Time as he relives his "Memories of Pangea."
summary.name: Memories of Pangaea, Escape from Eden!

name: Tom Strong #004 (1999-10-01) - Swastika Girls!.cbr

summary.description: With cover and 8-page interior story by the legendary Art Adams complementing the work of regular Tom Strong artist Chris Sprouse, this issue plunges us back to the smoking ruins of a strangely unfamiliar Berlin in the last days of World War II, where we witness the alarming confrontation between Tom Strong and the Nazi superwoman Heidi Weiss amidst the rubble and the shadows of a broken Europe. No fan of our pulp titan can afford to miss Swastika Girls!
summary.name: Swastika Girls!

name: Tom Strong #003 (1999-08-01) - Aztech Nights.cbz

summary.description: In the thrilling third issue of America's Best Comics' flagship title, the pulp-science- fiction powerhouse finds marvelous Millennium City, and indeed his entire Earth, menaced by the trans- dimensional terror of the Aztechs! In the first appearance of these sun-worshipping cyber-conquerors from a parallel world, Tom Strong must fight alone within the golden Ziggurat of Fear as he struggles to survive the perils and pitfalls of "Aztech Nights."
summary.name: Aztech Nights

name: Tom Strong #002 (1999-07-01) - Return of the Modular Man.cbr

summary.description: Tom, Dhalua and Tesla battle the Modular Man! Will they be able to stop him--again? Or will Modular Man wreak havoc in Millennium City?
summary.name: Return of the Modular Man

name: Tom Strong #001 (1999-06-01) - How Tom Strong Got Started.cbr

summary.description: Intertwining the 'present-day' timeline of Timmy Turbo and the origin timeline for Tom Strong, we learn that Tom grew up on an island with mysterious, perhaps magical properties. While Timmy reads each of the three parts of the origin, Tom is also on the fringes of Timmy's timeline, helping foil a robbery attempt happening right around Timmy.
summary.name: How Tom Strong Got Started

name: Tokyo Storm Warning #003 (2003-12-01) .cbr

summary.description: The saga of giant robots vs. horrible monsters reaches a shocking conclusion! Zoe Flynn is piloting the most amazing vessel ever conceived, a massive ARCangel designed to battle the mutant monsters threatening Tokyo. But who designed these super machines? And for that matter, where did the monsters come from? It's all a mystery...until Zoe pulls back the curtain and spies the wizard pulling the strings!

name: Tokyo Storm Warning #002 (2003-09-01) .cbr

summary.description: The miniseries pitting giant robots against nuclear monsters continues! What would really happen if a giant robot was thrown into a building? Zoe Flynn, a U.S. pilot on a military exchange program, may just find out, as she's thrust into a war between machines and monsters! Training on simulators didn't prepare Zoe for the awesome challenge of piloting an ARCangel, and now she'll need every weapon at her disposal to save Tokyo, and herself, from the immense creatures that seem to randomly appear, mysteriously drawn to the center of the city!

name: Tokyo Storm Warning #001 (2003-08-01) - Tokyo Storm Warning.cbr

summary.description: Giant robots and atomic monsters collide in a new miniseries by Warren Ellis and James Raiz (Transformers)! In the present day, Zoe Flynn, American pilot, is sent to Tokyo on an exchange scheme to pilot the ARCangels, immense combat robots used to protect Tokyo from the giant monsters that have been plaguing it for some 50 years!
summary.name: Tokyo Storm Warning

name: Adventure Comics #496 (1983-02-01) .cbr
Titanium Rain Double-Sized #002 (2009-11-04) - Issue 2 of 2.cbr

summary.description: High in the skies over war-torn China, Alec's fight for survival has become desperate. With his plane badly damaged and his wingman killed, all the odds are against him as two enemy Dracos close in for the kill. Will Alec make it home in one piece, or be forced to eject over enemy territory? And what world events spiraled into the Sino Conflict?
summary.name: Issue 2 of 2

name: Titanium Rain Double-Sized #001 (2009-09-01) - Issue 1 of 2.cbr

summary.description: Written by Josh Finney. Art by Kat Rocha. The instinct to survive is what has made us who we are. In the year 2031, mankind's survival instinct is put to the test when a civil war in China spirals into global conflict. Nations are destroyed. Millions are killed. For many, like US Air Force pilot Alec Killian, survival will mean shedding some of his humanity in exchange for biotech and machine. Titanium Rain follows one pilot's journey through mankind's worst, only to discover its best. Combines the previously released debut issue with the all-new issue #2.
summary.name: Issue 1 of 2

name: Thorgal #011 (2011-12-01) - The Invisible Fortress.cbr

summary.description: Still travelling with Kris of Valnor, Thorgal runs afoul of a local tribe. When a mysterious old woman offers him a chance to escape the hostile villagers, he accepts. But there’s more to the bargain: She says that if he can make his way into the Invisible Fortress, he’ll be able to erase his name from the Stone of the Gods, cancelling his destiny—and finally have a chance at a normal life.
summary.name: The Invisible Fortress

name: Thorgal #010 (2011-08-01) - The Sun Sword.cbr

summary.description: A wandering Thorgal is captured and enslaved by Orgoff, a cruel man who appointed himself the local lord after defeating the old one. Orgoff wields the dreadful power of the Sun Sword, which the peasants say makes him invulnerable. Thorgal, of course, is not convinced. Escaping, he encounters the last of the rebels against the new order—and an old enemy. Together, they will have to defeat Orgoff and his allies and recover the Sun Sword.
summary.name: The Sun Sword

name: Thorgal #009 (2010-09-01) - The Guardian of the Keys.cbr

summary.description:
Thorgal is back in his old village with his family, but once again his destiny catches up with him when Volsung of Nichor, sent by the snake Nidhogg, steals the belt of the Guardian of the Keys, which grants invulnerability. Nidhogg wants to destroy the Guardian and spread chaos throughout the universe, while Volsung just wants to become king of the world–but they both want Thorgal dead. And Volsung has taken on Thorgal’s appearance…

Reprints #17 of the original series.
summary.name: The Guardian of the Keys

name: Thorgal #008 (2010-06-01) - Wolf Club.cbr

summary.description:
Thorgal, Aaricia and Jolan sail north, and are almost home when they encounter the drakkar of Wor the Magnificent, the new king of the Northland Vikings. When Thorgal refuses to follow Wor on a raid, he and his family are left to finish the short trip on foot.

When Thorgal leaves a near-term Aaricia with Jolan and goes to find transportation, enemies appear and threaten them all. As they fight for their lives in the wild, it is from the wild that life will come…

Reprints #16 of the original series.
summary.name: Wolf Cub

name: Thorgal #007 (2010-03-01) - The Master Of The Mountains.cbr

summary.description:
Thorgal and his family are back in Europe, where a pregnant Aaricia insists on giving birth in Northland. Unable to find a ship to sail north in the middle of winter, Thorgal sets off by land to reach his old village and bring back a drakkar. His trip takes him through the land of Saxegaard, Master of the Mountains, a ruthless warlord who terrorizes the surrounding country. One night, in a burntout cottage, he meets Torric, an escaped slave, and finds a strange ring in the ashes. An extraordinary adventure begins…

Reprints #15 of the original series.
summary.name: The Master Of The Mountains

name: Thorgal #006 (2009-09-01) - City of the Lost God.cbr

summary.description:
Thorgal, Aaricia and Kriss of Valnor are finally approaching Mavaxatl, the city of the lost god. When Thorgal understands the real goal of their mission and Kriss’s duplicity, he tries to escape. But Kriss is determined that he complete the mission...

This two-volume book includes “Between Earth and Sun."

Reprints #12 and #13 of the original series.

NOTE: Certain illustrations of this edition have been modified.
summary.name: City of the Lost God

name: Thorgal #004 (2008-09-01) - The Archers.cbr

summary.description:
Jolan has become a robust kid who is interested in everything. The strange signs he draws without knowing their meaning thoroughly intrigue his parents. During one escapade, he makes friends with a boy his age. The child seems to be lost and is terrified of adults. Along with being deaf and mute, he cannot answer questions raised by his mysterious presence.

Surprised by a storm, Thorgal has been taken in by an old couple. Without boat or money, he can’t return to his village. Perhaps an archery competition will allow him to buy a new boat. Of all the competitors, the beautiful Kriss de Valnor is without any doubt the most formidable...

This two-volume book includes “Alinoe”.

Reprints #8 and #9 of the original series.
summary.name: The Archers

name: Thorgal #001 (2007-03-01) - Child of the Stars.cbz

summary.description:
In the wild and inhospitable European far north, in the land of Scandinavian myth and runic legend, Viking warriors discover a child in a space capsule. Leif Haraldson adopts him and gives him the names of his gods: Thorgal Aegirsson, son of Thor (god of lightning) and son of Aegir (master of the sea). Upon Leif’s death, the Viking chief Gandalf the Insane isolates Thorgal from others. Only the friendship of Aaricia, the daughter of Gandalf, brightens Thorgal’s solitary childhood. Their mutual affection quickly turns into true love.

This two-volume book includes “Aaricia”.

Reprints #7 and #14 of the original series.
summary.name: Child of the Stars

name: Thor- Vikings #005 (2004-01-01) - See you in Valhalla.cbr

summary.description: Thor's allies from time fight well and are promised a spot in Valhalla. The murderous vikings are defeared.
summary.name: See you in Valhalla

name: Thor- Vikings #004 (2003-12-01) - Fight the Good Fight.cbr

summary.description: Thor and Dr. Strange go back through time to gather a force to face the ZOMBIE VIKINGS!!
summary.name: Fight the Good Fight

name: Thor- Vikings #003 (2003-11-01) - Time like a river.cbr

summary.description: Dr. Strange helps Thor fight Harald Jaekelsson and his band of Zombie Vikings who are pillaging modern day Manhattan. But who can stop Garth Ennis from pillaging the Marvel Universe?!
summary.name: Time like a river

name: Thor- Vikings #002 (2003-10-01) - Kingdom of Iron.cbr

summary.description: Thor & Doctor Strange team-up to try to find a way to defeat the invincible zombie Vikings that have invaded Manhattan!
summary.name: Kingdom of Iron

name: Think Tank: Creative Destruction #002 (2016-05-31).cbr

summary.description:
Quantum cryptography. The TALOS project. The military industrial complex is going insane while David loses his mind over his long distance relationship with Mirra.

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
ACover ARahsan Ekedal1
BCover BRahsan Ekedal2

name: Think Tank: Creative Destruction #001 (2016-04-30).cbr

summary.description:
An unknown enemy destroys the technological infrastructure of the United States. Panic and conspiracy theories spread as David Loren and his misfit science team continue work on the TALOS project, trying to make “Iron Man” suits a reality in California.

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
ACover ARahsan Ekedal1
BCover BRahsan Ekedal2
CCover CRahsan Ekedal3

name: Think Tank #003 ( 2014-03-01)  - Outbreak.cbr

summary.description:
"OUTBREAK"

Slacker genius Dr. David Loren used to worry about the deadly consequences of his creations from the safety of his laboratory... but not anymore! Deployed to Taiwan to oversee a field test gone awry, will having a SEAL Team as his bodyguards be enough to ensure that David returns home outside of a body bag?

Collects THINK TANK #9-12.

Note: The digital edition (3/19/2014) for this volume was released before the print edition.
summary.name: Outbreak

name: Think Tank #002 ( 2013-07-01)  - Genetics.cbr

summary.description: Two months after the flashy and brilliant escape from the DARPA funded military think he used to call his home, slacker/genius Dr. David Loren has willingly returned to his lab to continue his work that he not long ago wished to be no part of. When a weapons designer loses his moral compass, who are the true victims of his creations? Collects THINK TANK #4-8 and THINK TANK MILITARY DOSSIER #1.
summary.name: Genetics

name: Think Tank #001 ( 2012-12-31)  - Volume 1.cbr

summary.description:
Written by Matt Hawkins. Art by Rahsan Ekedal. Cover by Rahsan Ekedal, and Brian Reber. Dr. David Loren is many things: child prodigy, inventor, genius, slacker... mass murderer. When a military think tank's smartest scientist decides he can no longer stomach creating weapons of destruction, will he be able to think his way out of his dilemma or find himself subject to the machinations of smaller men?

Collects Think Tank #1-4.
summary.name: Volume 1

name: The Unwritten #034 (2012-04-01) - Part Four of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words.cbr

summary.description: Tom has fought his way through to the holy of holies, where the Cabal's high council sits in judgment over the world. But stripped of his magical powers, he's just one man against a vast machine – and against the even more sinister power that lurks behind it.
summary.name: Part Four of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words

name: The Unwritten #033 (2012-03-01) - Part Three of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words.cbr

summary.description: Recovered and recharged, Tom is ready to invade the cabal's inner sanctum as "Tommy Taylor and the War of Words" continues. And the Cabal are more than ready to receive him into the charged narrative space of the Grid. As Pullman's trap closes, revelations about the Cabal's true aims come thick and fast.
summary.name: Part Three of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words

name: The Unwritten #032 (2012-02-01) - Part Two of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words.cbr

summary.description: Tom's battle against the cabal continues, with Glitterspar as the ultimate sanction. But Tom discovers that letting storybook magic into your world is playing with fire – and ice.
summary.name: Part Two of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words

name: The Unwritten #031 (2012-01-01) - Part One of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words.cbr

summary.description: The game-changing, twice-monthly epic called "Tommy Taylor and the War of Words" begins now! Tom Taylor goes to war against the cabal that has tormented, imprisoned and tried to destroy him – and it's far more than just a war of words! To have a hope of winning, Tom must use every weapon he can get hold of, but even storybook magic carries its own risks. And for a story unlike any you've ever seen, one issue a month isn't enough! In the special, standalone .5 issues, Tom's crusade plays out against the backdrop of the cabal's sinister secret history and delves deep into the dark past of some of the series' major players. When it's all over, very little will remain Unwritten.
summary.name: Part One of Tommy Taylor and the War of Words

name: The Unwritten #030 (2011-12-01) - On to Genesis, Conclusion.cbr

summary.description: The finale of "On to Genesis!" In 1930s New York, Wilson Taylor confronts the true enormity of his betrayals, while in the present day, Tom comes face-to-face with their aftermath – and the link that binds him both to the Tinker and his creator.
summary.name: On to Genesis, Conclusion

name: The Unwritten #026 (2011-08-01) - Citizen Taylor, Part Two of Two.cbr

summary.description: The hammer goes down, the auction starts, and lot number 100 is Tom Taylor. Who's going to be bidding, and what do they want him for? Tom hopes he never finds out - but he's out of options, in the hands of his enemies, and locked in a sensory deprivation tank that's terrifyingly familiar...
summary.name: Citizen Taylor, Part Two of Two

name: The Unwritten #024 (2011-06-01) - Stairway to Heaven.cbr

summary.description: The return of Mr. Bun! In between the worlds of story, there is a staircase – and legend says that at the top of the stairs there's another world entirely. Mr. Bun is going to find it if it's the last thing he does, and God help anyone who stands against him. Or with him, for that matter...
summary.name: Stairway to Heaven

name: The Unwritten #023 (2011-05-01) - Leviathan, Part Five.cbr

summary.description: Tom's search for the source of his father's power has ended in disaster, as he joins an eclectic group of doomed mariners in a trap that they all should have seen coming. But there's one great whale he hasn't even met yet, and it's the most powerful of all. Maybe it has the answer to Tom's question – if he lives long enough to ask it.
summary.name: Leviathan, Part Five

name: The Unwritten #021 (2011-03-01) - Leviathan, Part Three.cbr

summary.description: Cut off from his friends and trapped in a novel with a tragic ending, Tom confronts Captain Ahab, tries his hand at grand theft narrative, and meets a monster. But this isn't any kind of monster he was expecting!
summary.name: Leviathan, Part Three

name: The Unwritten #017 (2010-11-01) - The Many Lives of Lizzie Hexam.cbz

summary.description: Special guest artist Ryan Kelly provides finishes over Peter Gross's art for "The Lives of Lizzie Hexam: A Choose-a-Story adventure." Enter the mind of Lizzie Hexam, Tom Taylor's fervent but enigmatic guardian, and explore the contradictory, impossible events that made her what she is. Is she a victim or champion? A madwoman or a saint? That's for you and fate to decide as you pick the story's path. The multiple Eisner-nominated series tells its most ambitious stand-alone story to date in an oversized, interactive issue!
summary.name: The Many Lives of Lizzie Hexam

name: The Unwritten #016 (2010-10-01) - Dead Man's Knock- Conversations.cbr

summary.description: When Tom and Wilson Taylor come face-to-face, secrets are revealed, friends and enemies unmask, and chickens come home to roost. All this plus exclusive coverage of the launch party for the 14th Tommy Taylor novel – an unexploded bomb and a perfect gift for loved ones.
summary.name: Dead Man's Knock: Conversations

name: The Unwritten #015 (2010-09-01) - Dead Man's Knock- Bloodlettings.cbr

summary.description: While Lizzie wanders through a Dickens novel in search of a past she thought she'd left behind her, Tom pursues his father through the streets of London and ends up in a maze made out of stories. Hopefully he'll realize this maze has a monster at its heart...
summary.name: Dead Man's Knock: Bloodlettings

name: The Unwritten #014 (2010-08-01) - Dead Man's Knock- Atrocities.cbr

summary.description: The unveiling of the new Tommy Taylor novel is only a day away. London is locked down tight, and Tom's enemies are starting to circle – but it's his friends he should be watching…
summary.name: Dead Man's Knock: Atrocities

name: The Unwritten #013 (2010-07-01) - Dead Man's Knock- Monsters.cbr

summary.description: New storyline! Tom Taylor is back in London hoping to connect with his father at the launch of his new novel. But he's not the only one: The Cabal has sent their hit man to kill Wilson Taylor if he appears. And as other monsters converge on Tom, he starts to realize that he's walked into not one trap but two...
summary.name: Dead Man's Knock: Monsters

name: The Unwritten #012 (2010-06-01) - Eliza Mae Hertford's Willowbank Tales.cbr

summary.description: A stand-alone story! Come visit Willowbank Wood, the home of cuddly, friendly little creatures like Dogling, Nedward, Tig the Hedgehog – and a psychotic assassin with a grudge and a plan.
summary.name: Eliza Mae Hertford's Willowbank Tales

name: The Unwritten #011 (2010-05-01) - Jud SÃ¼ss, Part 2- The Canker.cbr

summary.description: In a city haunted by its own past, Tom Taylor tries to help a very different kind of tormented ghost – and discovers the many ways the dead can threaten the living.
summary.name: Jud Süss, Part 2: The Canker

name: The Unwritten #010 (2010-04-01) - Jud SÃ¼ss, Part 1- The Liar.cbr

summary.description: The start of a new storyline! Tom Taylor discovers the true meaning of "out of the frying pan" as his escape from Donostia jail takes him to Stuttgart – in 1940! It's a ghost city inhabited by the master liar of the Third Reich, Josef Goebbels, and a tortured soul who's crying out for rescue – or death...
summary.name: Jud Süss, Part 1: The Liar

name: The Unwritten #009 (2010-03-01) - Inside Man, Conclusion.cbr

summary.description: As Donostia jail burns, assassins stalk its corridors in search of Tom Taylor — and so do the children who've decided to be his saviors. But there's one terrifying encounter still to come, as the Inside Man finally unmasks.
summary.name: Inside Man, Conclusion

name: The Unwritten #008 (2010-02-01) - Inside Man- Interlude.cbr

summary.description: Tommy Taylor has affected the lives of millions, winding his way into their dreams and fantasies. But sometimes dreams and fantasies are a poisoned cup. In the prison of Donostia, innocence meets experience with tragic results...
summary.name: Inside Man: Interlude

name: The Unwritten #007 (2010-01-01) - Inside Man- The Song of Roland.cbr

summary.description: In Donostia Prison, Tom Taylor confronts a monster and the mystery of his own nature. But the hidden cabal that framed Tom in the first place is now working towards his death — and they've got the help of an inside man...
summary.name: Inside Man: The Song of Roland

name: The Unwritten #006 (2009-12-01) - Inside Man, Part One.cbr

summary.description: As the Tommy Taylor fanbase reels in the aftermath of the Villa Diodati slayings, Tom arrives at Donostia prison in Southern France and falls into the orbit of another story: The Song of Roland. Unfortunately for Tom, it's a story that ends with a massacre...
summary.name: Inside Man, Part One

name: The Unwritten #005 (2009-11-01) - How the Whale Became.cbr

summary.description: In the India of the British Raj, young journalist and would-be novelist Rudyard Kipling gets an offer he can't refuse. It's an offer that will catapult him to fame, fortune and inexorable destruction. The secret history of the Unwritten begins in this stand-alone story...
summary.name: How the Whale Became

name: The Unwritten #004 (2009-10-01) - Tommy Taylor and the Bogus Identity, Conclusion.cbr
